page.title: 16A NURSERY SCHOOL IN HESSLE
page.content: The Penshurst School Nursery caters for children aged three and four years of age. Children attend either a morning or afternoon session of two and a half hours. Children like playing with things that remind them of real life. Mice and frogs entertain the children, while at the same time they are learning. Trains are very popular. One of the corners is decorated to look like a real house. Another is decorated like a hospital. Most of the children enjoy playing with the sand as it reminds them of the sea-side. Sometimes the children have dancing. Usually this means an action song such as "Dry Bones". Halfway through the morning or afternnon there is singing or discussions followed by orange and biscuits. At the end of the session the teacher reads them all a story.
